mortgage.title: Fed holds interest rates steady: What that means for mortgages, credit cards and loans
mortgage.description: From mortgage rates and auto loans to credit cards and savings accounts, here's a look at how the January Fed decision could affect your finances.

mortgage.description: From mortgage rates to auto loans and credit cards, here’s a look at how the upcoming January Fed decision may affect your finances.

economy.title: Fed holds interest rates steady, taking a pause from rate cuts to assess the economy
economy.description: The central bank cut rates at its three previous meetings in an effort to support the job market. But with inflation still elevated, the Fed is cautious about additional rate cuts.

economy.title: Trump says he’ll announce his Fed pick Friday morning. Here’s who’s in the lead, according to prediction markets.
economy.description: President Donald Trump said he’ll announce his nominee to chair the Federal Reserve on Friday morning — and prediction markets have turned sharply toward a former Fed governor for the post.

economy.title: Trump says inflation was 'defeated.' Some economists disagree
economy.description: President Donald Trump said the U.S. "defeated" inflation and reined in consumer prices over the past year. Federal data suggests otherwise.

investing.title: Gold rally stalls as prices drop 4% after a sharp run-up; Asia-Pacific stock markets trade mixed
investing.description: Asia-Pacific markets traded mixed after U.S. President Donald Trump said that he will announce his choice for the next Federal Reserve chair on Friday.

investing.title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 29: Joby Aviation Falls After Announcing $1.2 Billion Stock and Convertible Note Offerings
investing.description: Today, Jan. 29, 2026, investors weigh massive new fundraising against mounting dilution risks in the race to launch eVTOL air taxis.

investing.title: GameStop mania fed off investor angst. Experts say that unease still fuels ‘gamblifying’ of investing
investing.description: Five years after GameStop stock fueled a revolution among retail investors, their angst will likely continue to fuel speculative buying, experts said.

investing.title: One Fund Just Bet $3 Million on an ETF Down 10% During a Bull Market
investing.description: This asset management firm targets long-term growth by investing in U.S. companies with strong management and reinvestment potential.

investing.title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 29: AT&T Climbs as Earnings Confirm Cash Flow Strength
investing.description: AT&T rose after earnings confirmed steady cash generation amid a softer market backdrop.

investing.title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 29: Nio Advances as Autonomous EV Focus Lifts Shares
investing.description: Nio moved higher as autonomous EV interest resurfaced, standing out amid a mixed market and uneven trading across Chinese EV stocks.

investing.title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 29: Microsoft Slides and Meta Surges
investing.description: On Jan. 29, 2026, a rare post-earnings tumble in Microsoft rattled tech stocks even as the Dow hovered near records.

investing.title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 29: Microsoft Falls After Azure Growth Slows and AI Spending Raises Investor Concerns
investing.description: Today, Jan. 29, 2026, investors are weighing slowing cloud momentum against surging AI infrastructure spend at a software giant.

investing.title: ‘I’m worried about cash flow’: I’m 71 with a $2.7 million IRA and $470K in stocks. Why can’t I relax?
investing.description: “My home is paid for and has an estimated value of $700,000.”

debt.title: Don’t wait for Trump's 10% cap, Fed cuts — here's how to get a better credit card interest rate now
debt.description: President Trump has called for a 10% cap on credit card interest rates. What to know to get a lender's best rates sooner.

taxes.title: IRS owes some taxpayers refunds for pandemic-era penalty tax relief, watchdog audit finds
taxes.description: An audit from a government watchdog alerted the IRS of the mistake and the agency took steps to credit the tax accounts affected by the oversight.
